data.enText: -ies

data.chText: 可能；可能性
data.enText: the fact that sth might exist or happen, but is not certain to

data.chText: 她现在已不可能完全康复。
data.enText: There is now no possibility that she will make a full recovery.

data.chText: 他拒绝排除增税的可能性。
data.enText: He refused to rule out the possibility of a tax increase.

data.chText: 我们大家将来有一天再度聚在一起，并非绝不可能。
data.enText: It is not beyond the bounds of possibility that we'll all meet again one day.

data.chText: 如果销售情况得不到改善，真有破产的可能。
data.enText: Bankruptcy is a real possibility if sales don't improve.

data.chText: 过去看似不可能的事，现在显然有可能了。
data.enText: What had seemed impossible now seemed a distinct possibility .

data.chText: 可选择的方法
data.enText: one of the different things that you can do in a particular situation

data.chText: 探究 / 考虑 / 调查各种可能的情况
data.enText: to explore/consider/investigate a wide range of possibilities

data.chText: 用尽一切可能的手段
data.enText: to exhaust all the possibilities

data.chText: 卖掉房子只是我们可以选择的其中一种做法。
data.enText: Selling the house is just one possibility that is open to us.

data.chText: 可想的办法是无穷的。
data.enText: The possibilities are endless .

data.chText: 机会；契机
data.enText: something that gives you a chance to achieve sth

data.chText: 这门课程可提供一整套新鲜活泼的技能训练。
data.enText: The course offers a range of exciting possibilities for developing your skills.

data.chText: 潜力；改进的余地
data.enText: if sth has possibilities , it can be improved or made successful

data.chText: 这房子虽亟待修缮，但仍有可资利用的价值。
data.enText: The house is in a bad state of repair but it has possibilities.

data.chText: 以上各词均指某种情况下的选择。
data.enText: These are all words for sth that you choose to do in a particular situation.
option

data.chText: 指可选择的事物、选择、选择权、选择的自由：
data.enText: something that you can choose to have or do; the freedom to choose what you do

data.chText: 据我看，我们有两种选择…
data.enText: As I see it, we have two options…

data.chText: 学生在二年级时可以选择出国学习。
data.enText: Students have the option of studying abroad in their second year.

data.chText: option亦指计算机程序里的选项、选择：
data.enText: Option is also the word used in computing for one of the choices you can make when using a computer program.

data.chText: 从编辑选单上选择“剪切”项。
data.enText: Choose the ‘Cut’ option from the Edit menu.
choice

data.chText: 指选择权、选择的自由、选择、可选择的事物：
data.enText: the freedom to choose what you do; something that you can choose to have or do

data.chText: 如果让我选择，我明天就停止工作。
data.enText: If I had the choice, I would stop working tomorrow.

data.chText: 你有很大的选择余地。
data.enText: There is a wide range of choices open to you.
alternative

data.chText: 指可供选择的事物、其中一种选择：
data.enText: something that you can choose to have or do out of two or more possibilities

data.chText: 你的工资可以按周以现金支取，或按月以支票支取。二者可选其一。
data.enText: You can be paid in cash weekly or by cheque monthly: those are the two alternatives.

data.chText: 用option、choice还是alternative？
choice较option稍非正式，而alternative更正式些。表示选择权或选择的自由最常用choice，不过有时也可用option，但通常不用alternative：
data.enText: Choice is slightly less formal than option and alternative is slightly more formal. Choice is most often used for ‘the freedom to choose’, although you can sometimes also use option (but not usually alternative ).

data.chText: 如果让我选择，我会…
data.enText: If I had the choice/option, I would…
If I had the alternative, I would…

data.chText: 父母在教育方面的选择权
data.enText: parental choice in education
parental option/alternative in education

data.chText: 表示可选择的事物用option、choice或alternative均可。不过，alternative较常用以指两项而非多项之间的选择。
data.enText: Things that you can choose are options , choices or alternatives . However, alternative is more frequently used to talk about choosing between two things rather than several.
option, choice or alternative?
possibility

data.chText: 指某种情况下可选择的事物：
data.enText: one of the different things that you can do in a particular situation

data.chText: 我们需要探究各种可能的情况。
data.enText: We need to explore a wide range of possibilities.

data.chText: 可想的办法是无穷的。
data.enText: The possibilities are endless.

data.chText: possibility的用法与option、choice和alternative相似，不过，其重点主要在于可选择的事物而非需要作出选择。
data.enText: Possibility can be used in a similar way to option , choice and alternative , but the emphasis here is less on the need to make a choice, and more on what is available.
with/without the option/choice/possibility of sth
a(n) good/acceptable/reasonable/possible option/choice/alternative
the only option/choice/alternative/possibility open to sb
your best option/alternative (is to…)
to have a(n)/the option/choice of doing sth
to have no option/choice/alternative ( but to do sth)
a number/range of options/choices/alternatives/possibilities
not much option/choice

tr: a tentative insight into the natural world
a concept that is not yet verified but that if true would explain certain facts or phenomena
example: a scientific hypothesis that survives experimental testing becomes a scientific theory
he proposed a fresh theory of alkalis that later was accepted in chemical practices

tr: capability of existing or happening or being true
example: there is a possibility that his sense of smell has been impaired

value.def: If you say there is a possibility that something is the case or that something will happen, you mean that it might be the case or it might happen.

example.ex: We were not in the least worried about the possibility that sweets could rot the teeth...
example.tran: 我们以前完全不担心吃糖果有可能会蛀牙。

example.ex: Tax on food has become a very real possibility.

value.def: A possibility is one of several different things that could be done.

example.ex: The government now owns a lot of our land — one possibility would be  to compensate us with other property...
example.tran: 政府现在占了我们的大量土地，一种可能是用其他地产来对我们作出补偿。

example.ex: There were several possibilities open to each manufacturer.
example.tran: 每个制造商都可以有几种不同的选择。

value.def: You can say 'It is not beyond the realms of possibility' or 'It is not beyond the bounds of possibility' when you are stating something that you believe is possibly true, but which other people might consider unlikely or impossible.

example.ex: It's not beyond the realms of possibility that the security services do bug important public figures.
example.tran: 安全部门完全有可能窃听重要公众人物的谈话。

value.boxu_tran: 注意不要说：I had the possibility to do it，而要用opportunity或chance。opportunity一词比较正式，例如：Later Donald had the opportunity of driving the car（后来，唐纳德有机会开这辆车了），The people of Northern Ireland would have the chance to shape their own future（北爱尔兰人民会有机会决定自己的未来的）。
value.boxu_usage: Note that you do not use possibility in sentences like 'I had the possibility to do it'. The words you need are opportunity or chance. Opportunity is more formal. Later Donald had the opportunity of driving the car… The people of Northern Ireland would have the chance to shape their own future.

trans: 生产可能性；可能性曲线；生产能力
万一,也许；万一；也许；可能
缺乏可能性；极小的可能性，微弱的可能
如重大可能性；很大的可能性
